Heritrix writes files as the user who launched the Java VM in which it 
is running. That appears to be 'tomcat' in your setup.

 From the shell, the command 'umask' changes the default permissions 
used for writing new files; using this to change the 'tomcat' user's 
defaults before launching the Heritrix JVM might have the desired 
effect. (I'm not sure.)

If that doesn't work, it appears we could try to set files 
everyone-readable from within Heritrix (as a new feature in the future), 
but we've never had this request before, and it might not be the right 
choice for everyone. (So, if we added it, it might need to be 
configurable). So I would prefer this be resolved outside Heritrix, with 
OS/user facilities, if at all possible.

- Gordon @ IA
